results.title: Nike revenue 2005-2025
results.content: Nike's revenue increases considerably each year, however in fiscal 2024, Nike sales rose by less than one percent.

results.title: NIKE, Inc. Reports Fiscal 2024 First Quarter Results
results.content: *    First quarter revenues were $12.9 billion, up 2 percent compared to prior year on a reported and currency-neutral basis*. *    NIKE Direct revenues were $5.4 billion, up 6 percent compared to prior year on a reported and currency-neutral basis with growth across all geographies. *   **_Revenues_**for NIKE, Inc. increased 2 percent on a reported and currency-neutral basis to $12.9 billion compared to the prior year. *    Revenues for the NIKE Brand were $12.4 billion, up 3 percent on a reported and currency-neutral basis, led by currency-neutral growth in EMEA, Greater China and APLA, partially offset by a decline in North America. *    Operating overhead expense increased 2 percent to $3.0 billion, primarily due to wage-related expenses and NIKE Direct variable costs, partially offset by lower technology spend. 3 Corporate revenues primarily consist of foreign currency hedge gains and losses related to revenues generated by entities within the NIKE Brand geographic operating segments and Converse, but managed through the Companyâ€™s central foreign exchange risk management program.

results.title: Nike (NKE) - Revenue
results.content: ## **Revenue in 2025 (TTM): $46.44 Billion USD**. According to **Nike**'s latest financial reports the company's current revenue (TTM ) is **$46.44 Billion USD**. In 2024 the company made a revenue of **$48.97 Billion USD** a decrease over the revenue in the year 2023 that were of **$51.54 Billion USD**. The revenue is the total amount of income that a company generates by the sale of goods or services. | 2024 | $48.97 B | -4.97% |. | 2023 | $51.54 B | 4.96% |. | 2022 | $49.10 B | 6.05% |. | 2021 | $46.30 B | 21.05% |. | 2020 | $38.25 B | -6.2% |. | 2019 | $40.78 B | 7.05% |. | 2018 | $38.09 B | 9.68% |. | 2017 | $34.73 B | 3.63% |. | 2016 | $33.51 B | 6.95% |. | 2015 | $31.33 B | 5.31% |. | 2014 | $29.75 B | 13.21% |. ### Revenue for similar companies or competitors.
